com.nttdocomo.ui
Class Canvas

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.nttdocomo.ui.Frame
        |
        +--com.nttdocomo.ui.Canvas
public abstract class Canvas
extends Frame

This class defines the display for low-level APIs. The Canvas class is a frame class to be used in low-level APIs. Canvas does not have the scrolling function.

See Also:
Panel, Dialog

Constructor Detail

Canvas

public Canvas()
This generates a canvas object.

Method Detail

getGraphics

public Graphics getGraphics()
This obtains a graphics object to paint on the canvas. The obtained object is in the initial state.
This generates a new object to call the getGraphics method and returns it.

Returns:
A graphic object to paint on the canvas

getKeypadState

public int getKeypadState()
This method returns the keypad status.

The location of each bit of the return value corresponds to the keys defined in the display class. The relation of bit-key is 1<<(the key value defined in the display class), MSB corresponds to 31 and LEB to 0. For example, the bit corresponding to KEY_0 is bit 0 and the bit corresponding to KEY_1 is bit 1. 

   b31                           b2  b1  b0
 +---+---+-------------||------+---+---+---+
 |   |   |                     |   |   |   |
 +---+---+-------------||------+---+---+---+
The bit corresponding to the pressed key is 1 and bits corresponding to unpressed keys is 0.

An application programmer obtains the status of several keys by calling this method during timer-driven processing or by calling this method when KEY_PRESS_EVENT or KEY_RELEASE_EVENT is generated.

Regardless of whether or not the canvas is displayed, the current keypad status shall be returned as the return value when this method is called.

Returns:
The keypad status.

paint

public abstract void paint(Graphics g)
This is the method for displaying graphics on the canvas. This method is called at the same time the canvas is displayed.
A graphics object to be set to the parameter is graphics that has been prepared by the caller of the paint method and initialized and set as necessary.
A graphic object sent by the parameter should not be disposed with the Graphics.dispose method by an application programmer. A caller of the paint method will dispose it by calling dispose method after processing implementation dependent. The behavior when an application programmer calls the dispose method is not identified.

Parameters:
g - Transfers graphics object used for painting.

processEvent

public void processEvent(int type,
                         int param)
This is the method called when a low level event is notified.

Parameters:
type - An event type is set.
param - A parameter of the event is set. The meaning of the parameter varies depending on the event. For an event that has no parameter, zero is set. See "ANNEX3 User Interface Function Specifications" for details.

repaint

public void repaint()
This instructs redrawing of the entire canvas.

repaint

public void repaint(int x,
                    int y,
                    int width,
                    int height)
This instructs redrawing of a rectangular part of the canvas. The part is comprised of (x,y),(x+width-1,y),(x+width-1,y+height-1) and (x,y+height-1)the width and the height described as (x,y)-(x+width-1, y+height -1).

Parameters:
x - Designates x-coordinate for the upper left of the rectangular area.
y - Designates y-coordinate for the upper left of the rectangular area.
width - Designates the width of the rectangular area.
height - Designates the height of the rectangular area.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Generated when either the width or the height or both are designated to be less than zero.
